semantic_title: Poisoning, Toxic Effects, Adverse Effects and Underdosing in Pregnant Patients
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 15. Pregnancy, Childbirth, and the Puerperium > m. Poisoning, toxic effects, adverse effects and underdosing in a pregnant patient

content.full_text: A code from subcategory O9A.2, Injury, poisoning and certain other consequences of external causes complicating pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium, should be sequenced first, followed by the appropriate injury, poisoning, toxic effect, adverse effect or underdosing code, and then the additional code(s) that specifies the condition caused by the poisoning, toxic effect, adverse effect or underdosing. See Section I.C.19. Adverse effects, poisoning, underdosing and toxic effects. (Evidence: pg no: 67, L64-L67)
content.summary: Sequencing guidelines for coding poisoning and related conditions in pregnant patients requiring multiple codes in specific order (Evidence: pg no: 67, L64-L67)
key_concepts: O9A.2 sequenced first for pregnancy complications (Evidence: pg no: 67, L66-L67)
Multiple code sequencing required (Evidence: pg no: 67, L66-L67)
Cross-reference to general poisoning guidelines (Evidence: pg no: 67, L67)

detailed_rules.rule_text: O9A.2 should be sequenced first, followed by poisoning code, then condition code (Evidence: pg no: 67, L66-L67)
detailed_rules.explanation: Poisoning in pregnant patients requires three-part coding with specific sequencing: pregnancy complication first, then poisoning type, then resulting condition (Evidence: pg no: 67, L64-L67)

workflow_steps: Step 2: Add appropriate poisoning/toxic effect/adverse effect code
Step 3: Add code for condition caused by the poisoning/effect
Step 4: Reference Section I.C.19 for additional guidance

code_ranges.description: Injury, poisoning and certain other consequences of external causes complicating pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium (Evidence: pg no: 67, L66)
usage_rules: Primary code for poisoning complications in pregnancy (Evidence: pg no: 67, L66-L67)

code_categories_mentioned: Subcategory O9A.2 - Injury, poisoning and certain other consequences of external causes complicating pregnancy, childbirth, and the puerperium

references_to.title: Adverse effects, poisoning, underdosing and toxic effects
references_to.explanation: Referenced for general poisoning coding guidance

coding_scenarios.scenario: Pregnant patient with accidental acetaminophen overdose causing liver injury
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: 30-year-old female at 20 weeks gestation with accidental acetaminophen poisoning resulting in acute hepatitis
step_by_step: Step 1: Assign O9A.2 for poisoning complicating pregnancy
Step 2: Add T39.1X1A for accidental acetaminophen poisoning
Step 3: Add K72.00 for acute hepatitis

correct_coding.sequencing: Pregnancy complication, then poisoning, then resulting condition
correct_coding.rationale: Three-part sequencing required for poisoning in pregnancy (Evidence: pg no: 67, L64-L67)

incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using only poisoning codes without pregnancy complication code

warnings: Must sequence O9A.2 first in poisoning cases (Evidence: pg no: 67, L66-L67)
best_practices: Use three-part coding sequence for complete documentation (Evidence: pg no: 67, L64-L67)
Reference Section I.C.19 for additional guidance (Evidence: pg no: 67, L67)
tips: Remember the three-part sequence: pregnancy complication, poisoning, condition
implementation_notes: Applies to all types of poisoning and toxic effects in pregnancy
clinical_context: Poisoning in pregnancy requires comprehensive coding for maternal and fetal safety
